summary: A ENB loosely inspired by Stakado Cinemascope Real ENB, using enbseries v 1.13. Focuses on combining Fantasy and Realism to capture the Harsh but beautiful land of Skyrim.
descriptionHtml:
UPDATE ADDED: Problems with color fixed, added a optional enb customizer preset inside the archive for easier installation. In order to get the full effect shown in the screenshots, you will need:
RCRN 3.0 Pure (Follow the instructions on the RCRN page to use it alongside this)
Imaginator with presets Warm Northern Lights, Magic Hour, Cool Midnight and Nice Overall Enhancement activated
Again, you don\'t like a certain feature, then tell me a suggestion or use the enb customizer to implement it yourself. I would love suggestions to make this better!
1.Description
2.Installation
3.Known Issues
4.Tips to improve performance (that don\'t make mouch of a difference to quality)
5.Credits

--------------------
Description
--------------------
A ENB loosely inspired by Stakado Cinemascope Real ENB, using enbseries v 1.13. Focuses on combining Fantasy and Realism to capture the Harsh but beautiful land of Skyrim. I recommend using enb customizer to change things.

----------------
Installation
----------------
Download enb series version 1.13 from Boris\' site.
Place all files into the Skyrim main folder.
Enable the \'Further Dark Dungeons for enb\' file in your mod manager.

-------------------
Known Issues
-------------------
Indirect lighting can cause very blue water sometimes. I don\'t know how to fix this.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tips to improve performance (that don\'t make much of a difference to quality)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Disable SMAA in the enb series ini by disabling Proxy.
Lower shadow quality in game launcher from ultra to high

I get 25-30 fps with my Nvidia GTS 250 CUDA and Core 2 Duo Processor with 4 Gigs of ram.

-------------------------------------
Credits
-----------------------
Boris Vorontsov for making ENB
Bethesda for the game
author: Cowgomoo
